dt: {bc}characterized by, being, or producing effects (such as drug responses or gene products) that when the causative factors act together are the sum of their individual effects

et: borrowed from Late Latin {it}additīvus,{/it} from Latin {it}additus{/it} (past participle of {it}addere{/it} "to {et_link|add|add}") + {it}-īvus{/it} {et_link|-ive|-ive}
shortdef: of, relating to, or characterized by addition
characterized by, being, or producing effects (such as drug responses or gene products) that when the causative factors act together are the sum of their individual effects

dt: {bc}a substance added to another in relatively small amounts to effect a desired change in properties

shortdef: a substance added to another in relatively small amounts to effect a desired change in properties

dt: {bc}an identity element (such as 0 in the group of whole numbers under the operation of addition) that in a given mathematical system leaves unchanged any element to which it is added

shortdef: an identity element (such as 0 in the group of whole numbers under the operation of addition) that in a given mathematical system leaves unchanged any element to which it is added

dt: {bc}a number that when added to a given number gives zero

shortdef: a number that when added to a given number gives zero

dt.t: Instead of the old approach of carving a usable part out of a large block of material, {wi}additive manufacturing{/wi} builds an object up layer by layer.
